name: Fairmont Le Chateau Frontenac

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012
reviews.text: Nothing outstanding - in retrospect, would have preferred to save the money and stay somewhere else - but I guess you have to stay at the Chateau Frontenac at least once in your life. Staff were very friendly and the location was very convenient from the train station - we were able to walk both ways.
reviews.title: A taste of history

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location, service, comfort, all was just perfect!
reviews.title: Awesome service! Felt like a princess..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My room had the best location facing the lake and it was very comfortable. I was treated like a princess, people (reception, bell man, ...) were very friendly and always had a smile on their faces. Nothing was missing. The castle is beautiful. And even at the end we had a lil surprise waiting for us in our car for our way back. They really thought of everything to make us happy!
reviews.title: Wonderful place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Chateau Frontenac is as one can expect. Wonderful services and staff.
reviews.title: A Perfect Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: We really enjoyed our stay over there. Everything was just perfect, except for the cleanliness of the room... I found some dust everywhere...Well, I guess real perfection does not exist!
reviews.title: Quebec's Finest

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a charming hotel in Old Quebec. The rooms are comfortable, but this is a pricy hotel. The view is beautiful and you can walk around and enjoy good restaurants all around. I suggest having a three course fondue at a restaurant right next to the hotel.
reviews.title: Nice but pricy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed there a night. It is a nice place and in a very touristy area. The view towards the old city is beautiful. It is a bit pricy though. Try the three-course fondue at the next door restaurant. It is fabulous!
reviews.title: Nice place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went for our Anniversary,it was awesome,just driving up to the big castle was amazing,we were greeted warmly by the valet,and the door man.At reception it was just as friendly,we later came to lobby to as where we could go for dinner,the recommendation was fantastic,so we went again the next night.Highly recommend this wonderful hotel,planning on coming back again.It is very central to everything,we walked everywhere.I felt the hotel was very clean,has everything you need and more.
reviews.title: Castle- Fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Danila
reviews.title: You can rely on excellent service here.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I love to stay in Fairmont Hotels, - you can count on great service, delicious and generous breakfasts, grand style of architecture, and live music in the evenings.
reviews.title: Spectacular view in Quebec City

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our stay at the Frontenac was great. It is all about location, location, location. I doubt that there is a more picturesque or convenient hotel when visiting QC. Parking is not ideal if you have a car but this is a medieval style town. If you do have a car don't use the hotel valet, walk down a bit and park in the public car park (way more economical).
reviews.title: Beautiful stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: The hotel itself is beautiful but old. The decorations are conservative and the feel is "older" which doesn't at all mean bad. Our room (a step up from the regular since we are gold members) was large enough, had two windows with gorgeous views, a very comfortable bed and was all around a wonderful place to stay when exploring this beautiful city. Perhaps paying full price for a regular room would be a little much at the Frontenac, the location honestly cannot be beat. If you are a member of Fairmont the deals can be truly good.
reviews.title: No better location and personal despite size

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Great location. Good service, especially from concierges and house keeping staff. Deluxe room sizes good (although a twin and a queen each has same size beds, just one not two). Spa and pool a little small for the size of hotel and number of guests, but well equipped.
reviews.title: Memorable experience!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Note that due to some odd license condition, children (basically those below legal drinking age) are not allowed in the St Laurent Bar area at all - which is where the key refreshment areas (and terrace) are. Great for us adults when we wanted a reason to escape the children but not that great if you want to sit out as a family.
reviews.title: Fairmont Château Frontenac Québec city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Ideal location! From this Iconic hotel you can venture around this beautiful medieval city on foot, and enjoy breathtaking views of the St Laurence river from the wide boardwalk. Plenty of good dining options, and street shows in the immediate vicinity.
reviews.title: Beautiful Place To Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: This hotel has it ALL!!! We went December 19-23rd. I basically found nothing negative about the experience! The staff is EXTREMELY friendly and helpful. The indoor pool and jacuzzi are beautiful and overlook the city! One recommendation! Get the Bed & Breakfast package! Call them ahead of time for it! The buffet breakfast served daily includes gratuity and is just FANTASTIC FOOD!!! It's a great deal and the restaurant is beautiful!
reviews.title: AMAZING!

likes.disliked: — The sofa bed could be a bit more comfy!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: This hotel is full of charm, the toboggan slide open in winter is great! Watching families go down the high speed slide along the gorgeous St. Lawrence river is one of the more calming and fun parts of staying at this magical place! :)
reviews.title: A wonderful stay at Le Chateau Frontenac

likes.liked: — Hotel's beauty and history; spacious, comfortable room; location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I wish we had stayed longer!
reviews.title: room 1717

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Le Chateau Frontenac Feb. 14-18, the last weekend of Carnival and had an excellent time.
reviews.title: Magical - like being in a snow globe!

likes.disliked: — At times, difficult to get a taxi

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were in room 4263 and friends were in 4255; both rooms had views of the park, the toboggan run and, if you craned your neck, the river. Our room was spacious, quiet and clean, with a king bed, a wing chair and ottoman, a table, two night stands, desk, etc., etc. The water pressure in the shower was somewhat weak (nothing horrible, though). Our friends, on the other hand, described their shower as the "Saint Lawrence coming directly out of the nozzle," so our weak pressure may have been a fluke.
reviews.title: Absolutely Outstanding

likes.liked: — It was beautiful and the service was excellent.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: A 5 day stay at the Frontenac was an absolute pleasure! This is a grand and elegant property, with a staff that is extraordinarily pleasant and helpful. Despite the fact that there is exterior construction in and around the hotel (preparing for Quebec's 400 year in 2008), it was simply a great stay.
reviews.title: A Classic Property

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: The hotel is in a perfect location in the heart of Old Quebec City, with plenty of restaurants and sites very close by. If you have a chance to stay at teh Frontenac, by all means, do so!
reviews.title: Impressive hotel - no more

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: Stayed for 4 nights at the Chateau for a Conference and was pleasantly surprised with overall hotel infrastructure.
reviews.title: Incredible experience
Very Nice Place
reviews.text: On the positive side: hotel lobby is impressive and magnificent, check-in very friendly and smooth, bellman was very fast, overall service was good, cafe de la terasse offered a great breakfast buffet with fresh products

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007
reviews.text: On the negative side: room was on the small side for $300 and bathroom was ridiculously small (you could barely fit on the toilet), construction was all around and luckily I was away all day from the room or it would have been impossible to relax, the gym is ridiculously small for a 600-room hotel.
reviews.title: A+ Location & Beautiful Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Words are insufficient to convey the experience of living for a few days in such a place of Canadian History. This hotel is fairytale like in all of its finishes. We were a family of four and never tired of exploring all of the interesting aspects of this property. Being winter, we availed ourselves of the many family friendly activities in the Quebec City area...i.e. toboganning on the terrace outside the hotel, using the ferry to cross the river, riding on the Furnicular, driving out to see the Ice Hotel and spending a day at the Valcartier Village winter amusement park.
reviews.title: EXCEPTIONAL

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fairmont clearly focuses on the attention to detail...e.g. they provided complimentary child size robes to enjoy while using their pool aswell as ensuring friendly encounters with all manner of staff. Our suite was historical in its charm and maintained to a very high standard. The worst part of our stay was having to leave. I highly recommend this property to those making this their first or perhaps only visit to Quebec City.
reviews.title: The most amazing hotel ever!!!
How could you stay anywhere else in Quebec City
reviews.text: This amazing castle must be one of the most magical places I have ever stayed in. We were there for 3 nights as part of our honeymoon and fell in love with this little town and the hotel. Firstly, you will spend about 10 minutes before entering the hotel just admiring the outside. We had a very large room which overlooked the water. You are in the heart of quebec city, so restuarants, cafes etc are at your doorstep. The staff were very friendly and helpful. My husband left some clothes in our hotel in montreal and they organised for it to be sent to us.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Quebec city is like a little old french town, so staying here made the experience even more beautiful. I would definately go back to quebec and stay here only.
reviews.title: Happy New Years!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: Especially in Quebec City, don't even think about staying anywhere else if you are here to see Old Quebec (which everyone is). Don't worry about the $$$$$, as you will defnly be thankful you spent the extra moola.
reviews.title: A beautiful hotel with a lot of charm

likes.liked: — the beauty of the hotel itself
likes.disliked: — the high price of drinks in the lounge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled on business
reviews.text: We had a lovely room in this Chateau..it is a very impressive building and on such a great location overlooking the St Lawrence river..
reviews.title: Nice heritage hotel

likes.liked: — Lovely chateau overlooking the st Lawrence river

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we were there it was full with ice and snow so it was great!!
reviews.title: A grand, historic hotel...
Awesome experience
reviews.text: We have no experience with dinner in the hotel but the breakfast was excellent.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overview. We consider the old walled City of Quebec (Vieux-Quebec) to be one of the most romantic places in North America and the Chateau Frontenac is literally right in the middle of it.
reviews.title: Classic Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Location: This grand, historic hotel is located in a magnificent setting high above the Saint Lawrence River adjacent to the picturesque "Historic District of Old Quebec". This is one of the oldest cities in North America and is rich in French, British and Canadian history. During the French and Indian War, the British laid siege to the nearby French Citadel and won a decisive victory over the French at the Battle of the Plains of Abraham in 1759. This important battle was the beginning of the end of French dominance in North America. These historic sites are literally steps from the hotel.
reviews.title: Very comfortable hotel in an excellent location.

likes.disliked: — Potential noise during the week due to construction.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I spent six nights at the Chateau and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. It is the center of the Quebec universe, with a row of restaurants outside the entrance and more restaurants and shops right below. We opted for a lower floor with a larger room and garden view rather than paying $330 + tax more for the six nights for a river view and less space. We loved our room, 3240, as it was spacious, had an excellent layout and a super big bathroom with electrical plugs and counter space for our travel espresso machine which we don't leave home without. We had five large windows, so we received a lot of natural light during the day. The weather outside was much warmer than we had anticipated, but the air conditioning has virtually no limits. If you like arctic indoor temps., which we do, the temperature control is excellent. The hotel reminded me a bit of the Broadmoor hotel in Colorado Springs, which is amongst my favorites in the world. I loved the charm, the dog, Santol, and the service was generally excellent, but unobstrusive. We had cocktails at the bar a couple of evenings and really enjoyed the experience. They make outstanding martinis, cosmos, Margs.; probably everything and the salty sweet mix of nuts and chips that they serve with drinks is great. It was odd to be in such a large hotel and not have a room safe and the hotel doesn't appear to have any security, has many doors, stairways, corridors and lots of public/non-guests that flow through, yet it still feels safe. We did have issues with the housekeeping on two days. After the first night, we spent most of the morning/day out and our room remained unmade when we returned. We called for service and it was made up quickly. The second day began the same, except we didn't get service ever. We spoke to a floor supervisor, who only spoke French, which my husband speaks poorly, and a woman who was making up rooms, and were assured that it would be done within a half-hour, went out and returned and hour later to the room unmade. We called housekeeping and they said that someone would come immediately and no one did. Eventually, I tracked down a guy doing turn down service and asked for towels and toiletries. He was kind enough to bring a cart by and allow me to empty the trash and recyclables. The person who said that she would do our room came by later and apologized for not cleaning it; said that the day was complicated and that our room was not on anyone's service list. Ridiculous really, but things happen, even in fine hotels. We stay in ten to twelve hotels per year and no stay is perfect. In the end, in spite of the housekeeping mishap, I would still rate the hotel as excellent and would highly recommend it to others. On a final note, it is very beneficial to be a member of the Fairmont President's Club, which is free to join, as it grants priority check-in, includes wireless or wired Internet and the daily delivery of the newspaper to the room.
reviews.title: A Grand Dame; not old, but historic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It doesn't get much better than this. If you want history, charm, excellent service and perfect location the Chateau fills the bill. Hotel staff very helpful and friendly. We would definitely retun again. We got a room with king bed. Maybe next time may try 2 double instead. Rooms with 2 double beds seemed bigger.
reviews.title: Wonderful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a nice stay here, but given the price and hype wasn't amazing. It's in a good location and the public areas/restaurants are good but the rooms are a little cramped and outdated.
reviews.title: Nice but not amazing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having said that, there are probably other rooms that are larger but for the price I'd perhaps suggest staying elsewhere and coming here for a drink (the bar is lovely and has great views) or a meal.
reviews.title: Great Hotel - Don't eat at their Restaurant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: I have not been to this hotel for over 20 years.
reviews.title: Failed to deliver what they promised

aka: Fairmont Le Chateau Frontenac Hotel Quebec City
description: Standing high on a bluff overlooking the mighty St. Lawrence River, Fairmont Le Château Frontenac is not merely a hotel located in the heart of Old Québec - it is the heart of it. At Fairmont Le Château Frontenac, guests are guaranteed a memorable and inspiring stay in one of the most beautiful cities in the world with easy walking access to all of the wonderful sites and experiences that Old Québec has to offer.
